The Willow Project has been approved. Here's what to know about the controversial oil-drilling venture
description: On March 13, the Biden administration approved the controversial Willow Project in Alaska.

title: Russian fighter jet forces down US drone over Black Sea
description: A Russian fighter jet forced down a US Air Force drone over the Black Sea on Tuesday after damaging the propeller of the American MQ-9 Reaper drone, according to the US military.

title: Michael Jordan's 1998 NBA Finals sneakers are expected to smash auction records
description:
In 1998, Michael Jordan laced up a pair of his iconic black and red Air Jordan 13s to bring home a Bulls victory during Game 2 of his final NBA championship  — and now the sneakers are going on sale and expected to smash auction records.

Sotheby's in New York will offer up the game-winning sneakers next month, for a high estimate of $4 million, with open bidding to take place online from April 3 to 11. The current record from 2021 — a pair of Nike Air Ships that Jordan wore early in his career — is $1.47 million, which marked the first time a set of sneakers sold for more than $1 million.

title: Vehicle hits teenagers riding stolen horses, killing 1 rider and 2 horses, Dallas Police say
description: A 14-year-old was killed and two other teens were hospitalized Tuesday after a vehicle crashed into them while they were riding horses that the Dallas Police Department says were stolen.

title: Russian jet forces down US drone over Black Sea in 'reckless' encounter
description: A Russian fighter jet forced down a US Air Force drone over the Black Sea on Tuesday after damaging the propeller of the American MQ-9 Reaper drone, according to the US military.

title: Here's why Biden's bank plan is not a bailout
description: The government's bailout during the 2008 financial crisis has drawn comparison to Biden's actions following Silicon Valley Bank's collapse. CNN business reporter Matt Egan outlines the difference.

title: Retired lt. general explains significance of Russian fighter jet forcing down US drone
description: A Russian fighter jet forced down a US Air Force drone over the Black Sea after damaging the propeller of the American MQ-9 Reaper drone, according to a US official familiar with the incident.

title: George Santos files paperwork formally declaring 2024 candidacy
description: Scandal-plagued Rep. George Santos filed paperwork Tuesday with federal regulators formally declaring his 2024 candidacy.

title: Michelle Obama says her family felt a sense of responsibility to represent the Black community during White House years
description: Former first lady Michelle Obama said her family felt an enhanced sense of responsibility during their time in the White House as the first Black first family in American history.

title: Russian fighter jet forces down US drone over Black Sea after intercept
description: A Russian fighter jet forced down a US Air Force drone over the Black Sea on Tuesday after damaging the propeller of the American MQ-9 Reaper drone, according to a US official familiar with the incident.

title: Suspected poisoning kills three dogs at racing event in France
description: Three dogs have died from a suspected poisoning at a canine racing event in southern France, according to the local prosecutor.

He was lured by human traffickers with a 'dream job.' Then he got scammed
description: CNN's Kriste Lu Stout explains how young professionals across Asia are being targeted by high-tech human traffickers and lured into becoming online scammers.

title: 'Most intense baby race ever' is intensely cute
description: Crawling babies thrill crowd with "most intense baby race ever." CNN's Jeanne Moos reports.

title: Adam Levine believes 'it's about time' for Blake Shelton to exit 'The Voice'
description: This season of "The Voice" is set to be Blake Shelton's last, and former coach Adam Levine dosen't appear upset about that.

title: See why tensions are rising between US and China over Taiwan
description: CNN's Will Ripley reports tension between China and the US is on the rise, as the dispute over Taiwan continues and the self-ruled island looks to boost its asymmetric warfare capabilities against China's growing military threat.

title: CNN poll reveals who could be Trump's biggest competition for 2024
description: Former President Donald Trump took aim at Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis (R) during a recent campaign stop. Despite not announcing a bid for the White House, many see DeSantis as Trump's biggest rival for the GOP presidential nomination. CNN's Kristen Holmes reports.

title: Judge says US court handling medication abortion case has received 'barrage' of death threats
description: A federal judge told lawyers involved in a major medication abortion case last week that he did not want to publicize plans to hold a hearing in the case because of a "barrage" of death threats and other harassment that has been directed towards his courthouse, according to a transcript obtained by CNN of a private status conference.

title: 'Gotham Knights' and 'Superman & Lois' give the CW a less-than-super one-two punch
description: Superman and Batman sounds like a pretty solid one-two punch, but the details of that combination somewhat undo the CW's new Tuesday lineup, featuring the third season of "Superman & Lois" and a new Dark Knight-adjacent drama, "Gotham Knights." Specifically, the former doesn't fly as high this time out, while the latter plays too much like a "Riverdale" wannabe.

title: What you need to know about toxic 'forever chemicals'
description: You may have never heard of PFAS, but you likely have these potentially dangerous chemicals inside your body. CNN's Dr. Sanjay Gupta explains.

title: Volkswagen to invest $193 billion to hit EV target, picks Canada for battery factory
description: Volkswagen plans to invest 180 billion euros ($193 billion) over five years in areas including battery production and the sourcing of raw materials in a bid to cut electric vehicle costs and protect its market share, it said Tuesday.

title: Hundreds of US flights canceled as winter storm moves into Northeast
description: Hundreds of flights were canceled in the United States Tuesday and more than 1,200 delayed as a winter storm bringing heavy snow, winds and coastal flooding moved into the Northeast.

title: Missing teen was abducted and raped by man she met online and locked in a shed, authorities say
description: A 13-year-old girl reported missing in Dallas was found locked in a shed more than 1,000 miles away in North Carolina after she was abducted and raped by a man she met on a social media platform, authorities said.

title: Avril Lavigne's Juno Awards speech interrupted by a streaker
description: Avril Lavigne had quite the surprise on stage Monday.

title: Malawi death toll from Cyclone Freddy rises to 190
description: At least 190 people have died after Tropical Cyclone Freddy ripped through southern Malawi, the country's Department of Disaster Management Affairs said Tuesday.

title: EPA proposes first standards to make drinking water safer from 'forever chemicals'
description: The US Environmental Protection Agency on Tuesday proposed a new rule that would set the first national drinking water standard for "forever chemicals" that are dangerous to human health. The move could radically affect drinking water for nearly everyone in the United States.

title: Facebook-parent Meta plans to lay off another 10,000 employees
description: Facebook-parent Meta plans to lay off another 10,000 workers, marking the second round of significant job cuts for the tech giant in four months.

title: Rachel Bilson shares past intimacy issue other woman may relate to
description: Rachel Bilson is opening up about her sex life.

title: Major museums around the world are quietly recategorizing works from Russian to Ukrainian
description: The Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York has quietly reclassified some of its paintings. Two artists, once labeled Russian, are now categorized as Ukrainian and a painting by the French Impressionist Edgar Degas has been renamed from "Russian Dancer" to "Dancer in Ukrainian Dress."

title: Innovative aviation ideas shortlisted for 2023's Crystal Cabin Awards
description: From a cabin concept that completely eradicates the middle seat to a swanky design that takes single-aisle aircraft business class to a new level, this year's Crystal Cabin Awards shortlist offers an exciting glimpse at aviation's potential future.

title: 'Downton Abbey' castle halts weddings due to Brexit
description: It is a problem the butler of "Downton Abbey" might have sympathized with.

title: After record-breaking floods in Australia residents warned to avoid crocodile-infested waters
description: Queensland, Australia, has seen record-breaking flooding, with residents of some areas warned against traveling because of large crocodiles sighted in the floodwaters.

title: Opinion: Nigeria's young voters aren't done yet
description: As the sun began to rise over the bustling city of Lagos, Nigeria, a group of young people dressed in t-shirts and jeans were already gathered outside a polling station.

title: Credit Suisse finds 'material weakness' in its financial reporting, scraps exec bonuses
description: Credit Suisse on Tuesday acknowledged "material weakness" in its financial reporting as it scrapped bonuses for top executives in the wake of its worst annual performance since the global financial crisis.

title: Emma Raducanu shows signs of return to form as Briton marches on at Indian Wells
description: Winning tennis matches hasn't been Emma Raducanu's only concern lately -- staying injury free has become tricky for the British star.

title: Moody's puts six US banks on watch for potential downgrade
description: Moody's Investors Service placed six US banks on review for potential downgrades late Monday, in the wake of last week's collapse of Silicon Valley Bank.

title: Only 13 countries and territories had 'healthy' air quality in 2022
description: Only 13 of the world's countries and territories had "healthy" air quality last year, according to a new report, as air pollution surged to alarming levels in 2022.

title: What to know about pi on Pi Day
description: If you've been using Pi Day as an excuse to just eat pie, that's just peachy (or apple or chocolate cream). But there's so much more to know about pi.

title: Taiwan unveils its new combat and surveillance drones as China threat grows
description: A Taiwanese state-owned military weapons developer unveiled five new types of indigenous military drones on Tuesday, as the self-ruled island looks to boost its asymmetric warfare capabilities against China's growing military threat.

title: This US couple bought and renovated a 14th-century Italian home
description: Buying and renovating a home in Italy was something Doug and Leah Johnson had often dreamed about.

title: Xi's tightens grip, hardens stance on US: Key takeaways from China's annual political meetings
description: China's most important annual political meetings wrapped up Monday, leaving leader Xi Jinping firmly at the helm of a superpower that appears more eager to push back against the United States than at any time in decades.

title: Opinion: The FBI agent whose mom baked birthday cookies for Saddam Hussein
description: Two decades ago, on March 19, 2003, President George W. Bush ordered the US invasion of Iraq. Bush and senior administration officials had repeatedly told Americans that Iraqi dictator Saddam Hussein was armed to the teeth with weapons of mass destruction and that he was in league with al Qaeda.

title: Japan court orders retrial of longest-serving death row convict over 1966 murder case
description: The world's longest-serving death row convict was on Monday granted a retrial by a Japanese court in the latest twist in a legal saga dating back to the 1960s.

title: Australia, the UK and US are joining forces in the Pacific, but will nuclear subs arrive quick enough to counter China?
description: More than a year after the United States, the United Kingdom and Australia dropped the tightly held news they were combining submarine forces, the trio released more details Monday of their ambitious plan to counter China's rapid military expansion.

title: These videos are a reminder why Russia is being investigated for war crimes
description: The International Criminal Court is planning to open two war crimes cases tied to the Russian invasion of Ukraine and issue arrest warrants against "several people," according to the New York Times and Reuters, citing current and former officials with knowledge of the decision who were not authorized to speak publicly. CNN's Matthew Chance reports.

title: Asian markets tumble as SVB fallout fears rattle banking sector
description: Asian stocks fell broadly on Tuesday, dragged down by banking shares, as fears over the fallout of Silicon Valley Bank's collapse gripped the market despite US government efforts to stabilize the financial system.

title: Biden says Carter asked him to deliver his eulogy
description: Former President Jimmy Carter has asked Joe Biden to deliver his eulogy following his death, the president said Monday.

title: Ukraine's future being decided in east of country, Zelensky says
No public holiday for Michelle Yeoh's Oscar win, Malaysia says following false rumors
description: Michelle Yeoh's history-making Oscar win caused jubilation this week in her native Malaysia, but it also sparked false rumors that a national holiday had been declared -- something the country's government quickly dispelled.

title: China is fully reopening to foreign visitors
description: After three years of pandemic border restrictions, China is fully reopening to foreign visitors -- including tourists.

title: Japanese billionaire behind the rise of 7-Eleven dies at 98
description: Masatoshi Ito, the Japanese billionaire who turned 7-Eleven convenience stores into a global empire, has died aged 98, closing the chapter on one of Asia's most storied retail entrepreneurs.

title: Analysis: America's biggest problem is its politics, not its banks
description: The dramatic meltdown of Silicon Valley Bank is proving one thing for sure -- the biggest systemic risk to the United States lies not in its banking system but in its polarized politics.

title: Michelle Obama: 'No accident' Obama White House was 'scandal-free'
description: During an appearance her podcast, "The Light Podcast," former first lady Michelle Obama says the family was mindful of how their actions while in office would reflect upon Black Americans.

title: Former Fox producer for Tucker Carlson feared truth telling would insult 'dumb' audience
description: In the course of the $1.6 billion defamation lawsuit filed by Dominion Voting Systems against Fox News, legal documents reveal new text messages between a Fox executive and Tucker Carlson's former producer have come to light, revealing how they corresponded about Donald Trump's election lies.

title: 'Lambs to the slaughter': Hear Russian soldier's battlefield letter
description: Former Defense Secretary Mark Esper reacts to a letter obtained by CNN from a Russian soldier detailing the battlefield experience in the war against Ukraine.

title: White House calls on Pence to apologize for 'homophobic joke' about Buttigieg
description: The White House on Monday called on Mike Pence to apologize for his remark that Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg had gone on "maternity leave," saying that the former vice president's "homophobic joke" at the Gridiron Club dinner on Saturday was "offensive and inappropriate."

title: Hear George Conway's prediction about possible Trump indictments
description: Conservative lawyer George Conway joins CNN's Erin Burnett to discuss former President Donald Trump's ongoing legal battles.

title: Mediterranean diet linked with reduced risk of developing dementia
description: There's no cure or proven way to prevent dementia, which affects 55 million people around the world, but a number of studies have said that following a Mediterranean diet may reduce the risk of developing the condition.

title: Why a wildlife photographer took 40,000 photos to capture these extraordinary birds
description: "I'm willing, more than most people, to go through some discomfort."

title: 'We are not rats': Some Ukrainians refuse to leave home as Russia threatens second capture
description: As Russia threatens a second capture of liberated Kupiansk, Ukraine, CNN's Melissa Bell talks to Ukrainian residents choosing to stay in their homes despite constant shelling.

title: Hear what needs to be done to prevent future bank failures
description: Former Treasury Secretary Larry Summers discusses what errors he thinks Silicon Valley Bank made, and what can be done to prevent future bank failures.

title: CNN follows migrants illegally entering Canada from New York road
description: CNN's Polo Sandoval visits Roxham Road, a northern US border entry in New York, where officials see an influx of migrants trying to use the illegal entry point to seek asylum in Canada.

title: Ukraine orders evacuations from liberated city, as Russians creep closer again
description: The artillery fire gets worse at night, so Liuba and her husband hold hands. It keeps them safe, she says with a sad nod of her head. She's standing in what's left of her garden after it was hit during a particularly bad night a month ago.
